aiInsights.summary: Arbitration case between Ceigall India Ltd. and GMADA. The case is in early stages with Statement of Claim filed. Respondent is expected to file Statement of Defence by next hearing.
aiInsights.recommendedAction: Prepare rejoinder draft anticipating common defenses. Monitor filing deadlines for respondent's Statement of Defence.

caseTitle: Ceigall India Ltd. vs PWD Shimla (Hamirpur Arbitration)

hearings.outcome: Award passed in favor of Claimant

documents.name: Dt. 04.07.2025 Final Award CIL & Shimla Hamirpur PWD Shimla.pdf
SOC - CLAM Hamirpur_Statement of Claim on behalf of the Claimant.pdf
SOD- Statement of Defence - Hamirpur Arbitration case (1).pdf
Rejoinder on behalf of the Claimant to the Statement of Defence filed by the Respondent.pdf

aiInsights.summary: Arbitration case concluded with Final Award dated 04.07.2025 in favor of Ceigall India Ltd. The case progressed through all stages including SOC, SOD, Rejoinder, and final arguments. Award has been passed and case is now closed.
aiInsights.recommendedAction: Archive case files. Monitor for any challenge under Section 34 of the Arbitration Act. Initiate execution proceedings if required.

caseTitle: S.R. Bommai vs Union Of India
judgeName: Kuldip Singh (J); Sawant, P.B.; Ramaswamy, K.; Agrawal, S.C. (J); Yogeshwar Dayal (J); Jeevan Reddy, B.P. (J); Pandian, S.R. (J); Ahmadi, A.M. (J)
underActs: Constitution of India;Government of Union Territories Act, 1963;Commissions of Inquiry Act, 1952

hearings.judge: Kuldip Singh (J); Sawant, P.B.; Ramaswamy, K.; Agrawal, S.C. (J); Yogeshwar Dayal (J); Jeevan Reddy, B.P. (J); Pandian, S.R. (J); Ahmadi, A.M. (J)

aiInsights.summary: The case S.R. Bommai vs Union Of India deals with the powers of the President to issue Proclamations under Article 356(1) of the Constitution and the Centre-State relations. The case is disposed of.

sections: u/s 19; section 4; u/s 9; 10; u/s 18; u/s 12 (2); u/s 23 (1A); Section 34; Section 28
respondent: Union of India; Delhi Development Authority

hearings.judge: Full Bench of the Hon'ble High Court
hearings.purpose: Dismissal of Civil Writ Petition No. 562/83 and 563/83

aiInsights.summary: The case pertains to land acquisition for planned development of Delhi. The petitioner was dissatisfied with the land rates assessed by the LAC and filed a reference petition u/s 18 of the LA Act. The court decided on the issues including limitation and market value of the acquired land, and awarded interest u/s 34.

caseTitle: Goan Real Estate & Constrn.Ld.& Anr vs Union Of India Tr.Sec.Min.Of Env.& Ors
underActs: Environment (Protection) Rules, 1986; Societies Registration Act, 1960; Environment Act, 1986
petitioner: Goan Real Estate & Construction Ltd. & Anr.
respondent: Union of India through Secretary, Ministry of Environment & Ors.

hearings.purpose: Judgment in Indian Council for Enviro-Legal Action vs. Union of India
hearings.outcome: Partly accepted the petition by striking down two amendments introduced by notification dated August 16, 1994
hearings.document: Indian Council for Enviro-Legal Action vs. Union of India, (1996) 5 SCC 281

hearings.purpose: Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority issued communication regarding constructions violating CRZ guidelines
hearings.outcome: Directed Additional Collector to ascertain whether clearance under CRZ had been obtained

hearings.purpose: Additional Collector, North Goa issued a stop work order
hearings.outcome: Directed the Police and Town Planning Authority to maintain the status quo at the site

hearings.purpose: Clarification issued by the Central Government through the Ministry of Environment and Forests
hearings.outcome: Clarified that new developmental activities would attract the provisions of CRZ notification of 1991 from April 18, 1996

hearings.purpose: Further clarification issued by the Additional Director of the MOEF
hearings.outcome: Clarified that any developmental activity initiated between August 16, 1994 and April 18, 1996 after obtaining requisite clearances should be construed as an on-going project

hearings.purpose: Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority addressed a communication to the Additional Collector
hearings.outcome: Decided that on the property of the petitioner No.l, `No Development Zone' should be marked at 100 meters and the stop work order, if any, in operation beyond such `No Development Zone' should be vacated

hearings.purpose: MOEF, Government of India, issued clarification
hearings.outcome: Requested the Member-Secretary, Department of Science, Technology and Environment of Government of Goa to get the matter examined by the Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority keeping in view the clarifications issued by the Ministry vide letter dated February 13, 2007

hearings.purpose: Additional Collector, Goa, passed an order
hearings.outcome: Vacated the stop work order dated December 12, 2006 but, in fact, permitting the construction beyond 100 meters and not 50 meters

hearings.purpose: Hearing of writ petition No.365 of 2007 in the High Court of Bombay at Goa
hearings.outcome: State of Goa would withdraw the stop work orders dated December 22, 2006 and May 23, 2007 to the extent, they imposed an embargo on construction between 50 meters and 100 meters

hearings.purpose: National Coastal Zone Management Authority considered the matter
hearings.outcome: Authority concluded that the stand taken by the MOEF vide letters dated January 24, 2007, February 13, 2007 and May 16, 2007 was correct one and was in accordance with the CRZ notification of 1991

aiInsights.summary: Goan Real Estate filed a writ petition to validate building plans sanctioned under the Coastal Regulation Zone Notification, seeking clarification on construction restrictions. The case involves disputes over 'No Development Zones' and the interpretation of prior Supreme Court judgments regarding construction permissions.
aiInsights.recommendedAction: Prepare for next hearing; gather additional evidence.

caseTitle: M/S. Ceigall India Limited vs National Highway Authority Of India & ...
petitionerAdvocate: Mr. Sandeep Sethi, Sr. Adv. with Ms. Apara Mahishi, Mr. Anshuman Pande, Mr. Mrigank Behl and Mr. Sumer Dev Seth, Advs.
respondent: NATIONAL HIGHWAY AUTHORITY OF INDIA & ANR.
respondentAdvocate: Mr. Manish K. Bishnoi and Mr. Khubaib Shakeel, Advs. for NHAI; Mr. Aditya Kumar and Ms. Ilanath, Advs. for R-2.

aiInsights.summary: M/S. Ceigall India Limited filed a writ petition against National Highway Authority of India challenging the declaration of its bid as non-responsive and seeking to prevent the forfeiture of its bid security. The court is considering whether the error in the bid amount was bonafide and whether NHAI can take penal action.
aiInsights.recommendedAction: Prepare for judgment delivery and any subsequent actions based on the outcome.

caseTitle: Manikonda Yadaiah And Another vs Srinivas Katta And 204 Others
underActs: Andhra Pradesh (Telangana Area) Tenancy and Agricultural Lands Act, 1950; Andhra Pradesh Land Reforms (Ceiling on Agricultural Holdings) Act, 1973; Urban Areas (Development) Act, 1975
sections: Section 91; Section 8; Section 38-E; Section 37-A; Section 19; Section 38(E); Section 38A; Section 38B; Section 22(1); Section 11; Section 13; Section 102(e); Section 38-D

hearings.outcome: Directed enquiry by the Collector or designated officer
Directed the R.D.O to dispose of the applications filed by the protected tenants

hearings.purpose: Allowed appeal and remitted back for fresh disposal
hearings.outcome: Appeal allowed and remitted back for fresh disposal
Directed authorities to consider applications of tenants
Appeals allowed by setting aside order dated 28.04.2001

hearings.purpose: Allowed CRP No.6708 of 2003 and dismissed CRP No.1200 of 2003
hearings.outcome: CRP No.6708 of 2003 allowed and CRP No.1200 of 2003 dismissed

hearings.purpose: Allowed the appeals and remitted the matter to the High Court
hearings.outcome: Appeals allowed and remitted the matter to the High Court

hearings.purpose: Disposing of CRP No.6708 of 2003 and batch, Remanded the matter to the Revenue Divisional Officer, Chevella
hearings.outcome: Matter remanded to the Revenue Divisional Officer, Chevella

aiInsights.summary: The case involves multiple civil revision petitions and writ petitions concerning land rights and tenancy issues in Gachibowli Village. The High Court disposed of these cases with a common order, after a prior remand from the Supreme Court and subsequent proceedings before the Revenue Divisional Officer.

caseTitle: Chief Commissioner Of Income Tax Osd ... vs M/S Ceigall India Ltd
petitioner: Chief Commissioner of Income Tax OSD Ludhiana
petitionerAdvocate: Mr. Rajesh Katoch, Sr. Standing Counsel; Ms. Pridhi Jaswinder Sandhu, Jr. Standing Counsel

hearings.purpose: Order of Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT)
hearings.outcome: Appeal filed by the revenue stands dismissed.

aiInsights.summary: The appeal filed by the revenue against the order of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) regarding the assessment year 2014-15 was dismissed by the High Court. The ITAT's decision involved issues of net profit rate application and unexplained expenditure additions.
